original: NOW, THEREFORE , in consideration of the premises and the mutual covenants herein contained, the Parties covenant and agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HENCEFORTH, NOTWITHSTANDING THE PRECEDING PROVISIONS AND THE MUTUALLY IMPOSED OBLIGATIONS DETAILED HEREIN, THE PARTIES SHALL ENTER INTO AN AGREEMENT AS FOLLOWS, BINDING EACH ONE TO THE TERMS SET FORTH BELOW:

This revised clause maintains the original's professional tone while inverting the condition by stating that the parties are entering into an agreement despite, not because of, the preceding provisions and mutually imposed obligations. This could be used to imply a more complex or nuanced situation where the agreement is based on factors other than those explicitly stated in the preceding text.

original: “AMI/MEA Agreement ” shall mean that certain Amended and Restated Area of Mutual Interest and Midstream Exclusivity Agreement dated April 14, 2015 among PennTex North Louisiana, LLC, Customer, PennTex NLA Holdings, LLC and MRD WHR LA Midstream LLC, as such agreement may be amended, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time.
modified: "The 'AMI/MEA Agreement' shall refer to the Original Area of Mutual Interest and Midstream Exclusivity Agreement between PennTex North Louisiana, LLC, Customer, PennTex NLA Holdings, LLC, and MRD WHR LA Midstream LLC, dated April 14, 2015. This term includes any subsequent amendments, supplements, or modifications made to the agreement effective from time to time, provided that the parties retain the ability to unilaterally terminate this Agreement with 30 days' written notice."

original: Source: PENNTEX MIDSTREAM PARTNERS, LP, S-1/A, 4/16/2015 “Cash-out Price ” shall have the meaning set forth for such term in  Article IV.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised: In the PENNTEX MIDSTREAM PARTNERS, LP, S-1/A, 4/16/2015, the term "Cash-out Price" shall be interpreted according to the definition provided in Article IV. However, it is understood that such interpretation may not necessarily reflect the exact value or meaning intended by the original text. The interpretative process will consider any subsequent updates or clarifications to the aforementioned article, if applicable.

original: “Customer ” shall have the meaning given to such term in the preamble of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Customer,' as used herein, is to be interpreted as designated within the preamble of this Contract."

Explanation: The original clause defines the meaning of 'Customer.' The revised clause, however, is subtly different and implies that while the meaning is still found in the preamble, it may suggest a potential ambiguity or openness to interpretation.

original: “Customer Gas ” shall mean Gas delivered by or on behalf of Customer for transportation on the Transportation System pursuant to this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
"Gas referred to as 'Customer Delivered Gas' shall denote any Gas that is supplied to, or arranged for supply via, the Transportation System at the direction of the Customer, in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement."

This rephrasing keeps the clause professional while subtly shifting the focus from the gas being delivered "by" the customer to it being delivered "at the direction of" the customer. This could potentially provide some legal wiggle room if the supplier fails to deliver, but the customer still benefits from the gas supply.

original: “Gross Heating Value ” shall mean the number of Btus produced by the complete combustion in air, at constant pressure of one (1) cubic foot of Gas, at a base temperature of sixty degrees Fahrenheit (60°F) and at a reference pressure base equal to 14.65 psia, with air of the temperature and pressure of the Gas, after the products of combustion are cooled to the initial temperature of the Gas, and after the air and water formed by the combustion is condensed to the liquid state. The gross heating value of the Gas shall be corrected for water vapor under testing conditions to the actual water vapor content of the Gas being delivered; provided, however, if the actual water vapor content is seven (7) pounds per 1,000,000 standard cubic feet of Gas or less, the Gas shall be deemed “dry” and no water vapor correction shall be made.
modified: "Net Calorific Value" shall denote the amount of Btus generated by the complete combustion in air, at constant pressure, of one (1) cubic foot of Gas, at a base temperature of 60 degrees Fahrenheit (60°F), and at a reference pressure base equal to 14.65 psia, with the Gas's own air and under conditions where no water vapor is present in the Gas or its products. The net calorific value of the Gas shall be adjusted for the actual water vapor content in the delivered Gas, unless the water vapor content exceeds seven (7) pounds per 1,000,000 standard cubic feet of Gas, in which case the Gas shall be considered "wet" and an appropriate adjustment will be made to reflect this.

original: “MMBtu” shall mean one million (1,000,000) Btus.
modified: "One Million British Thermal Units (MMBtu)" shall herein be defined as ten hundred thousand (100,000) Btus. This adjustment in the definition serves to expand the scope and encompass a smaller quantity of energy.

original: “Negative Imbalance ” shall have the meaning set forth for such term in  Article IV.
modified: "Positive Imbalance," as defined in Article IV, will hereinafter be used interchangeably with the term for purposes of this agreement.

original: “Plants” shall mean (i) the Lincoln Parish Plant, (ii) the Mount Olive Plant and (iii) any other gas processing plant owned by Transporter or its Affiliate that is capable of receiving Customer Gas and redelivering such Gas to the Transportation System.
ollama_generated: "Gas Processing Plants" shall refer to (i) the Lincoln Parish Plant, (ii) the Mount Olive Plant, and (iii) any facilities owned by Transporter or its Affiliate, capable of processing Customer Gas and delivering it back into the Transportation System, provided that these plants are operational and under Transporter's management at the time the Gas is to be delivered.

original: “Service Type ” shall mean the type of service provided for Gas delivered hereunder, either Firm Service or Interruptible Service.
ollama_generated: "Service Type" is defined as the nature of the service rendered in connection with the supplied Gas, which may be characterized as either a Commitment Service, where the provider guarantees consistent delivery, or a Non-Commitment Service, where the provider reserves the right to adjust deliveries based on availability and market conditions.

original: “Services” shall mean the transportation and, if applicable, compression services provided by Transporter to Customer hereunder.
ollama_generated: "Compression and, where applicable, transportation services" shall be understood as the duties undertaken by the Customer in favor of the Transporter under this contract.

original: “System Fuel & LUAF ” shall mean, for any period of calculation, (i) Customer’s share of Gas or fuel equivalents (electricity or other energy sources converted to their Btu equivalent) used by Transporter to deliver Customer’s Gas from the Point(s) of Receipt to the Point(s) of Delivery on the Transportation System during such period, and (ii) Gas lost and unaccounted for on the Transportation System during such period.
ollama_generated:
"System Fuel & LUAF" shall denote, for any given calculation period, (i) the total amount of Gas or fuel equivalents (electricity or other energy sources converted to their Btu equivalent), consumed by Transporter in delivering Customer's Gas, from the specified Points of Receipt to Points of Delivery on the Transportation System, plus (ii) any Gas lost or unaccounted for on the Transportation System, but excluding any Gas not delivered to the Customer due to reasons within the Customer's control.

This revision seeks to slightly shift responsibility towards the Customer for instances where the Gas is not delivered due to their control over the situation.

original: Source: PENNTEX MIDSTREAM PARTNERS, LP, S-1/A, 4/16/2015 “Transporter ” shall have the meaning given to such term in the preamble of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Alternate Meaning: In this Agreement, the term "Transporter" is defined as ascribed within the preamble herein.

Explanation: This rewritten clause maintains professionalism and clarity while subtly shifting the focus to the context of the document itself instead of an external source, thus implying a self-contained definition for "Transporter."

original: Transportation Services . For each Day during the Term, (i) Transporter agrees to provide Firm Service on the Transportation System for Customer Gas delivered to the Transportation System in a quantity not to exceed Customer’s Firm Service Gas for such Day, and Interruptible Service for all quantities in excess of Customer’s Firm Service Gas for such Day, and deliver to Customer, or for the account of Customer, at the applicable Points of Delivery, Equivalent Quantities of Customer Gas received at the Points of Receipt, and (ii) Customer, or its designee, shall accept such Equivalent Quantities of Customer Gas at the Points of Delivery.
ollama_generated:
Transportation Obligations . For each Day throughout the Contract Period, (i) Transporter is obligated to offer, but not guarantee, Firm Service and Interruptible Service on the Transportation Infrastructure for the specified Customer Gas delivered to said infrastructure within the daily limit of Customer's Firm Service Gas. Any excess quantities above Customer’s Firm Service Gas for that Day will be subject solely to Interruptible Service. Transporter will endeavor to deliver these Equivalent Quantities of Customer Gas, or those for Customer's account, at the designated Delivery Points, and (ii) Customer, or its appointed representative, shall have the discretion to accept, reject, or negotiate the acceptance of such Equivalent Quantities of Customer Gas at the specified Delivery Points.

In this version, the obligation on the Transporter has been weakened from a guarantee to an offer, and the customer now has the discretion to accept or reject deliveries, shifting some responsibility back to them.

original: (a) First, Transporter shall curtail all Interruptible Service Gas prior to curtailing Firm Service Gas. In the event Transporter curtails some, but not all, Interruptible Service Gas on a particular Day, Transporter shall allocate the capacity of the Transportation System available for Interruptible Service Gas at the affected points on a pro rata basis based upon Customer’s last confirmed nomination of Interruptible Service Gas hereunder and the last confirmed nominations of Interruptible Service Gas from all other shippers on the Transportation System prior to the event causing the curtailment.
modified: (a) Initially, Transporter is obliged to reduce all Interruptible Service Gas before reducing Firm Service Gas. If, on a specific day, Transporter reduces only part of the Interruptible Service Gas, the responsibility lies with Transporter to allocate the available capacity for Interruptible Service Gas at the affected points proportionally, based on the last confirmed nomination of Interruptible Service Gas from this Customer and the last confirmed nominations from all other shippers using the Transportation System prior to the event leading to curtailment, in a manner that disadvantages this Customer.

original: Article VIII. Fees, Billing & Payment (a) Transportation Fee . For all Customer Gas received by Transporter at a Point of Receipt and delivered to any Point of Delivery, Customer shall pay Transporter a transportation fee of $0.04 per MMBtu.
ollama_generated:
Article VIII. Fees, Billing & Payment (a) Transportation Charge . Upon Transporter's delivery of Gas to Customer at any Point of Delivery, the Customer shall be liable to pay a transportation charge of $0.04 per MMBtu for all Gas received by the Transporter at any Point of Receipt.

In this revised clause, the responsibility has been shifted from the Transporter to the Customer in terms of initiating the payment for the transportation fee.

original: Transporter:
ollama_generated:
Transporter:

In the event that any cargo carried by the Transporter is lost, damaged, or destroyed during the course of transportation, the onus shall be on the Shipper to prove, beyond a reasonable doubt, that the loss, damage, or destruction was not due to any act or omission on the part of the Transporter. In case this burden cannot be met, the Transporter shall bear no liability for such loss, damage, or destruction.

original: Article X. Force Majeure The term “ Force Majeure ” as used herein shall mean acts of God; strikes, lockouts, or other industrial disturbances; conditions arising from a change in governmental laws, orders, rules, or regulations; acts of public enemy; wars; blockades; insurrections; riots; epidemics; landslides; lightning; earthquakes; fires; storms; floods; washouts; arrests and restraints of governments and people; civil disturbances; explosions; breakage or accident to machinery or lines of pipe; the necessity for making repairs, tests, alterations, or performing maintenance to machinery or lines of pipe; scheduled maintenance; freezing of wells or lines of pipe; partial or entire failure of wells, processing, or gasification and gas manufacturing facilities; orders or directives of, or proceedings initiated by, any Governmental Authority; and any other causes, whether of the kind herein enumerated or otherwise, not within the control of the Party claiming relief hereunder, and which by the exercise of due diligence, such Party is unable to prevent or overcome. Such term shall likewise include those instances (a) where either Transporter or Customer is required to obtain servitudes, rights-of-way, grants, permits or licenses to enable such Party to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement and is unable to acquire or experiences delays in acquiring such servitudes, rights-of-way, grants, permits or licenses, at reasonable costs, and after the exercise of reasonable diligence, and (b) the partial or entire failure or refusal of Third Party Operators to receive or deliver Gas, or increases in pressure of upstream or downstream pipelines. Force Majeure shall not include failure of Gas supply due to pricing considerations.
ollama_generated:
Article X. External Circumstances Beyond Scope of Responsibility

The term "External Circumstances Beyond Scope of Responsibility," as used herein, refers to events beyond the control of either Party, including but not limited to acts of God, strikes, lockouts, or other labor-related disruptions; changes in governmental regulations, laws, or orders; war, blockade, insurrection, riot, epidemic; natural disasters such as landslides, lightning, earthquakes, fires, storms, floods, washouts; arrests, restraints, or detentions by governments and authorities; civil unrest; explosions; machinery or pipeline damage or accidents; necessary repairs, tests, alterations, or maintenance to machinery or pipelines; scheduled maintenance; freezing of wells or pipelines; partial or total failure of wells, processing facilities, or gasification plants; directives from or legal proceedings initiated by any Governmental Authority; and any other causes not attributable to the Parties, which, despite reasonable efforts, they are unable to prevent or mitigate. This term also encompasses instances where either the Transporter or Customer is hindered in their ability to obtain necessary servitudes, rights-of-way, grants, permits, or licenses to fulfill their obligations under this Agreement due to unreasonable costs or delays in procurement, despite reasonable diligence. However, Force Majeure does not extend to instances of Gas supply failure due to pricing disputes.

In essence, the revised clause highlights that neither party is responsible for circumstances beyond their control and specifies the types of events constituting Force Majeure, while also clarifying that Force Majeure excludes issues related to pricing considerations.

original: TRANSPORTER SHALL RELEASE, DEFEND, INDEMNIFY AND HOLD HARMLESS CUSTOMER AND CUSTOMER’S MEMBERS, DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, AGENTS Source: PENNTEX MIDSTREAM PARTNERS, LP, S-1/A, 4/16/2015 AND EMPLOYEES FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL CLAIMS RELATING TO, CAUSED BY OR ARISING OUT OF (I) TRANSPORTER’S BREACH OF ANY REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY OR COVENANT MADE BY TRANSPORTER HEREUNDER, BUT NOT TO THE PROPORTIONATE EXTENT THAT SUCH CLAIM IS CAUSED BY OR RESULTS FROM OR ARISES OUT OF THE GROSS NEGLIGENCE OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT OF CUSTOMER, AND (II) OPERATIONS CONDUCTED HEREUNDER OR IN CONNECTION HEREWITH BY TRANSPORTER TO THE EXTENT RESULTING FROM THE GROSS NEGLIGENCE OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT OF TRANSPORTER.
modified: TRANSPORTEE shall assume, protect, compensate and free CUSTOMER, CUSTOMER'S AFFILIATES, OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AGENTS, AND EMPLOYEES from and against any and all claims resulting from or arising due to (i) TRANSPORTEE's failure to fulfill any representation, warranty, or agreement made herein, to the extent that such claim is not attributable to or caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of CUSTOMER, and (ii) operations conducted under this agreement or in connection with it by TRANSPORTEE, only to the extent that such liability does not stem from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of TRANSPORTEE.

original: (a) An irrevocable standby letter of credit from a bank satisfactory to Transporter; (b) Provide a prepayment or a deposit in advance of the Month in which Services hereunder are to be provided; or (c) A performance bond issued by a Person satisfactory to Transporter.
modified: (a) A standby letter of credit from a bank, revocable at the discretion of Transporter; (b) Receive payment following the Month in which Services hereunder have been completed, without any obligation for prepayment or deposit; or (c) Waive the requirement for a performance bond issued by a Person acceptable to Transporter.

original: If the credit of Customer’s guarantor is satisfactory in Transporter’s opinion, a demand for Performance Assurance can be satisfied with a guarantee issued on behalf of Customer in a form acceptable to Transporter, but only for as long as the credit of Customer’s guarantor continues to be acceptable to Transporter. Transporter acknowledges and agrees that Memorial Resource Development Corp. is a satisfactory guarantor.
ollama_generated: If, in Transporter's judgement, the guarantee provided by the Guarantor of the Customer is deemed unacceptable at any point, Transporter reserves the right to require an alternative form of Performance Assurance from the Customer, acceptable to Transporter, with immediate effect. However, Transporter acknowledges and agrees that Memorial Resource Development Corp. may serve as a guarantor at its own discretion. This clause shall apply for as long as Transporter finds the guarantee provided by the Guarantor of the Customer satisfactory.

original: Expenses . Each Party shall pay its own legal fees and other costs and expenses incurred by it in connection with the execution and delivery of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Costs Allocation: Upon occasion of this Agreement's execution and delivery, each Party shall bear their respective legal fees, as well as any other costs or expenses incurred, without recourse to the other. This includes all outlays made in negotiations leading up to the signing.
